website_summaries.verdict: The Comfort Mouse is a basic mouse option at a basic price. Nothing fancy, but nothing terrible, either.
pros: BlueTrack allows for better mousing precision
cons: This is 2011.. BlueTrack still struggles on some surfaces

customer_reviews.title: OK for home office, not good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is an OK mouse. However for frantic clicking (such as that used in gaming) or extended click and drag operations using the left button, there is a problem. With the wrong direction of pressure on the left mouse button the right mouse button will engage. Once again, this is usually only during games like Diablo 3, but I have had it happen when doing click and drag operations in applications such as Microsoft Word.
customer_reviews.author: EtchyLives

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a general use office mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great for general office use simply for anything and everything that you might use it for. It has a chord so I prefer to use it with workstations. It is light with a great fit and feel. This is another mouse that Microsoft got right. The left and right clicks are very comfortable and have a nice soft sound to them. Highly recommend for a general office use mouse, works well and feels good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Suad

customer_reviews.title: A Mouse With A Tail -
customer_reviews.text: I had a wireless mouse that ate batteries. That gets to be expensive. My preference is a three button mouse, the scroll wheel acting like a button and this one has that capability. To my surprise, as soon as I plugged it in I got a prompt to download the drivers. A quick configure and the scroll wheel is not a "double click" button. I like that.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in California

customer_reviews.title: great price but feels a bit light
customer_reviews.text: I don't foresee having quality issues with this mouse. I currently have a MS ergonomic keyboard which is about 5 yrs old and it still works as well as the day I got it. I just wish I got the same discount as I did on this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Odd Fellow Amerigo

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is ok, big the scrolling wheel lacks precision. It feels like there are rocks in the bearings. The buttons are fine.
customer_reviews.author: john botsford

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Okay product, good basic mouse. The mouse clicks are way too loud which caused my rating to go down from 4 to 2.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco L. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good, but loud
customer_reviews.text: My only real complaint about the mouse is that the buttons do make a bit of noise when clicked. Beyond that, I'm quite happy with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie DenHerder

customer_reviews.title: Great, responsive mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse! Pro's: Lightweight, easy to carry and move with my laptop when I want a full mouse for it. Very responsive Comfortable Grip Con's It can sometimes feel too light, but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Buttons not very defined - easy to click both at once due (poor cover design)
customer_reviews.text: Buttons not very defined - easy to click both at once due (poor cover design). Slippery material - can't grip very well. Oversized as well - the sides are too wide/rounded. For a 'comfort' mouse, it isn't very comfortable. The biggest complaint I have is that the mouse wheel is garbage. It isn't very responsive, and on upward wheel movement, it misses or actually registers as downward movement. After 2 years of regular (non-gaming) use, it still works - but the mouse wheel issues prompted me to buy another brand. This mouse is twice the price of ones that actually work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Tracks Poorly...Comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this mouse as a stand-in for my second computer. It looks sleek and it was fairly cheap. Bottom-line is you get what you paid for. The blue-trac laser almost seems too sensitive; little hairs on my mouse pad throw it off and the mouse cursor twitches accordingly. This may be because it is almost too light. Good for surfing the web, lightweight and comfortable. But not for much else requiring higher precision.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Law

customer_reviews.title: Too big for my hand
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic mouse. With mice, the main thing is the size. I have relatively small hands so always prefer the smaller sizes and this one was a little too bulky for me. the good: * nice clean design * no 'extra' buttons. I never use these anyway... * rubber side grips * nice comfortable shape * good tracking * corded so no need for batteries things I didn't like: * a little too big for my hands * could use some lighter colors...
customer_reviews.author: Gil S

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, responsive, and not too fat
customer_reviews.text: A nice mouse that is easy on the pointer finger. It's light and responsive, works on any OS from Linux to ChromeOS to whatever Microsoft is selling these days. It never dies, so buy it unless you need a mouse for gaming or cad work.
customer_reviews.author: Zaine Ridling

customer_reviews.title: Basic cheap mouse
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Very lightweight. -Excellent tracking, I use it for gaming. -size and shape of mouse is fine. -Wired usb connection Cons: -Material feels cheap quality, 'rubber side grips' feel like hard cheap plastic, so I'd hardly call it a 'comfort mouse'. -$20 is overpriced, I have an alternate wireless mouse for when I need from logitech for $25. That mouse has real rubber side grips, quality material, and is comfortable. I'd rather have a wired version of that one.
customer_reviews.author: D W

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft's Smooth Scroll Wheel Performs Poorly
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately Microsoft continues to come out with many smooth scroll rather than click scroll wheel mice. Their new description for a click scroll wheel is "Detent". Currently, only one Microsoft mouse has the "Detent" description. A Microsoft smooth scroll wheel usually works great at first, but once the mouse wheel is broken in you will notice that the scroll movement becomes inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: ST Reviewer
